answerText: The Well of Loneliness[10] In The Well of Lonelinss, Stephen Gordon serves as an ambulance driver during this conflict.   Richard Aldington's Death of a Hero is set during this conflict, as is Hemingway's A Farewell to Arms.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | Finals 1 | 6 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This novel aroused controversy when it was published by Jonathon Cape even though its most obscene description of sex was the line "and that night they were not divided."  For 10 points each: [10] Name this 1928 novel whose protagonist, Stephen Gordon, becomes enraged when a maid named Collins kisses another servant.  Stephen later falls in love with a fellow ambulance driver named Mary Llewellyn.
